Talk0034:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Couldn't handle the <clr:0000>winterwing butterfly<clr:ffff>'s
eating habits, <sp:5:1:0>huh?

<sp:3:0:2:0100>Listen, some butterflies just prefer dung
and rotten fruit.

<sp:3:0:2:0a01>Rotten fruit's not for Beedle though.
<sp:0:2:2:5000>Never again.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk0035:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>A <clr:0000>sunset firefly<clr:ffff>?! Your loss is Beedle's
gain!<sp:5:1:0> Ooo... Want to know the secret to
their glorious glow?
<sp:3:0:2:0100>Those mysterious twinkles are caused by
two chemicals inside the firefly reacting
with each other.
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Beedle glows all by himself. No special
chemicals necessary!
Talk0012:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>Since you're the proud new owner of a
<clr:0000>restless cricket<clr:ffff>, here's a neat fact!<sp:5:1:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0100>Restless cricket babies look almost
identical to adults. The trick to telling
them apart is that the babies can't fly.
Talk0036:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>As a thank-you for your business, I've
got some words of wisdom for you.
No extra charge!
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Some folks say catching insects is
bad...

<sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_01><sp:0:2:2:7d00>But that's not true!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701><sp:0:2:2:6400>If you collect a few to appreciate them,
you aren't causing any harm.

But thinking we're better than bugs?
That really steams me up.

<sp:3:0:2:0301>If we destroy nature, there won't be
ANYTHING left. No bugs, no us, nothing!

<sp:3:0:2:0800>We're all in this together.
Talk0039:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Aieee! A <clr:0000>restless cricket<clr:ffff>! <sp:5:1:0>Now I'll just
count the legs...

<sp:3:0:2:0100>They can grow back missing legs when
they're young, but not when they're
adults. It's true!
Talk2030:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL>Ooo! Thank you! I knew you looked like
a stand-up fellow!

<sp:3:0:2:0100>Now, excuse me while I spend the day
spoiling this darling <clr:0000>beetle<clr:ffff>.
Talk2031:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL>*sniff* There is good in the world! I'm
going to spend the day treating this
beetle like royalty.
<sp:3:0:2:0100>And if you think I'm mushy, just wait
until you see this beetle's excretions.
Talk2010:
<sp:3:0:2:0100>Thanks for your business!<sp:5:0:0> Do you need
anything else?
Talk2011:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Oh! That's a shame.<sp:5:0:0> Well, I look forward
to your next visit.
Talk2012:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS>Thank you! I look forward to your
next visit!
Talk2013:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting>Oh! You again, huh? Did you forget to
buy something?
Com_Talk_30:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>All right, how many would you like
to buy?
Talk2017:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Ah! <sp:5:0:0>You'll generously give Beedle<sp:5:0:0> a
<clr:0000>rugged rhino beetle<clr:ffff>?!<sp:5:1:0>
Talk2018:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughS>Of course I'd make it a fair trade!
How about a <clr:0000>hearty elixir<clr:ffff>?

It's one of my special concoctions,
infused with <clr:0000>hearty lizard<clr:ffff> essence!
Talk2019:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughS>Of course I won't take no for an
answer! How about trading it for
an <clr:0000>energizing elixir<clr:ffff>?
It's a special medicine of mine I infuse
with <clr:0000>bright-eyed crab <clr:ffff>essence!
Com_Talk_12: <sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>I have lots of good stuff. Take your time!
Com_Talk_02b:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS>Thank you, thank you!<sp:5:0:0> Selling
anything else?
Com_Talk_13:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>I'll take it. How many would you like
to sell me?
Com_Talk_36:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Sold out for today?! Unbelievable!<sp:5:0:0>
I couldn't have done it without you!
Com_Talk_02c:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>You know Beedle gives good prices!<sp:5:0:0>
Do you have anything else to sell?
Com_Talk_37:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>All sold out today. Nothing left! Are you
interested in seeing the items I'm going
to stock next?
Com_Talk_02d: <sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS>Thank you!<sp:5:0:0> If you don't need it, I'll buy it!
Com_Talk_15: <sp:3:0:2:0c00>I can't buy that! Got anything else?
Com_Talk_16:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I can't buy something you're wearing!
Change, and we'll talk.
Talk0020:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Was the <clr:0000>deep firefly<clr:ffff> too intimidating for
you?<sp:5:1:0> I get it, I get it!

<sp:3:0:2:0100>Those primordial creatures have been
lighting the darkest dark since...always.

And luring in prey with that light?
Scary stuff!
Talk0022:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Ooo! A warm darner!<sp:5:1:0> You better watch
the back of your neck!

<sp:3:0:2:0100>That's just a little insect humor. <sp:5:0:0>Male
warm darners show their interest by
attaching on to the necks of their mates.
<sp:3:0:2:0300>But now that I think about it, you're
probably not his type.
Talk0023:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughL>It's Beedle's lucky day!


<sp:3:0:2:0c01>The gleaming golden exterior of this
stunner is unrivaled by any other beetle
on the market.
It sparkles! It dazzles! If I listed all of its
features, we'd be here all day!

This is a discerning beetle for the
discerning beetle enthusiast. In fact...

<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice>Oops.<sp:5:1:0> I got a little carried away, huh?
Talk0001:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>A <clr:0000>warm darner<clr:ffff>? Good choice! When they
leave the larval stage, they're fully grown
but fragile. That's called eclosion.
<sp:3:0:2:0101>Don't confuse it with "explosion," which is
very different!
Talk0024:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughL>You'll sell me a bladed rhino beetle?!


<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Its mottled shell—so fashionable!
Its bold horns—so noble!

This confident creature struts along the
trees of Hyrule, raising its horns to crush
obstacles, lifting its back legs to excrete...
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice>Oopsie.<sp:5:1:0> That's enough of that.
Talk0002:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>An <clr:0000>electric darner<clr:ffff>, huh?


<sp:3:0:2:0401>You have a discerning eye. Oh!
Speaking of eyes! Darner eyes
have tens of thousands of facets.
<sp:3:0:2:0500>So many facets...<sp:5:1:0> I wonder how discerning
they are.
Talk0025:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughL>That beetle's a good-luck charm!


<sp:3:0:2:0c01>See that regal head and striped mantle?
Those are the signs of a champ.

It makes the most lovely sounds when its
excited, but watch out! Those legs are
razor sharp. What a sweet little...
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice>Huh?<sp:5:1:0> Look at me carrying on.
Talk0003:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>If you want a <clr:0000>cold darner<clr:ffff>, <sp:5:1:0>you must not be
the type to give up on your dreams.

<sp:3:0:2:0100><clr:0000>Cold darners<clr:ffff> don't give up on their
dreams either. They grab on tight
with all six legs and don't let go.
And by dreams, I mean prey.
Talk0026:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Tonight my little friends will feast on this!


But I better taste it first to make sure it'll
agree with their tummies...
Talk0004:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>A <clr:0000>summerwing butterfly<clr:ffff>—good choice!<sp:5:1:0>
Do you also change when no one
is looking?
Butterflies undergo metamorphosis,
meaning their bodies change completely
when they turn into an adult.
<sp:3:0:2:0100>...Huh? What did you think I meant?
Talk0027:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Ooo! This will make a fine bed for my
little friends!

Sometimes, Beedle also curls up in a pile
of wood. Inns are expensive!
Talk2040:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Really?<sp:5:1:0> You'd turn down a deal like that?<sp:5:1:0>


Hm...<sp:5:1:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:CustomBadThink><clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>If he's going to be like that, maybe I can wait until
night and...<sp:5:1:0>no, no. I'll hire a thief to do it! I'll take
him for everything he's got!
Hehehehe...<sp:0:2:2:6400>


<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Notice><clr:ffff>Oh, don't mind me.<sp:5:1:0> Just let me know if
you change your mind.
Talk0005:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>The<clr:0000> <clr:ffff>smotherwing butterfly catch your
eye? Ah, good ol' Papilio vulcensis!

<sp:3:0:2:0b00>You've never heard of Papilio vulcensis?!<sp:5:1:0>
It's what you call a smotherwing when
you're doing science with it.
But "smotherwing butterfly" is a lot
easier to say.
Talk0028:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>As a thank-you for your business, I've
got some words of wisdom for you.
No extra charge!
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Did you know some folks think bugs
are scary?

<sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_01><sp:0:2:2:7d00>That's natural!<sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:0:4:0>They might not know about bugs, and the
unknown is scary. But if you pay attention
and get to know them...<sp:5:0:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0100>you'll see how amazing they are!


<sp:3:0:2:0800>It's against Beedle's life philosophy to
hate things without giving them a chance.
But I don't think you're like that!
Talk0029:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Eee, an <clr:0000>electric darner<clr:ffff>! <sp:5:1:0>This nimble little
fellow can zip right on over to me!

<sp:3:0:2:0101>Darners are quite the acrobats! They can
hover, fly in loops, and even go backward!

But "backward" doesn't mean a thing to
Beedle. <sp:5:0:0>It's only forward for me!
Talk0006:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Your purchase of a <clr:0000>thunderwing butterfly<clr:ffff>
comes with a free Beedle tip—<sp:5:1:0>how to tell
moths and butterflies apart!<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0100>Butterfly antennae are long and club-like.
Like a Bokoblin club! Except not like that
at all.
Talk0007:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>A <clr:0000>winterwing butterfly<clr:ffff>, huh?<sp:5:1:0> You must
know about their special scales!

<sp:3:0:2:0100>The scales coating their wings are
wintry-fresh. They put the brrr
in brrrilliant!
Talk2020:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>Maybe I can sweeten the deal. How about
trading it for a <clr:0000>fairy tonic<clr:ffff>?

<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughS>It's one of my special concoctions. The
secret ingredient is essence of <clr:0000>fairy<clr:ffff>!
Talk2043:
<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:CustomBigHappy>Wowee! Thank you!<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:6400>You don't see one of these every day!
Business will be good today—I can tell!<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>This <clr:0000>sunset firefly<clr:ffff> is dazzling! Stunning!


When I'm finished doting on this little
beauty, I'll return it to its natural habitat.

<sp:3:0:2:0300>Nature's balance can get bungled up if
you release an insect into a new habitat.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>Beedle's policy is to take care of nature
so nature can take care of bugs.
Talk2021:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>I wouldn't ask for it as a gift. Oh no!
How about trading it for a <clr:0000>tough elixir<clr:ffff>?
Talk2044:
<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:CustomBigHappy>Eeeeee! You're a star!<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:6400>It's hard to get your hands on one of
these. This is going to be a good day!<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk2022:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>I'll make it worth your while! How about a
<clr:0000>mighty meat and rice bowl <clr:ffff>in exchange?
Talk2023:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>I'll give you something in exchange,
of course! How about a <clr:0000>tough
vegetable omelet<clr:ffff>?
Talk2001:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Greeting>Hey there! Are you a fellow traveler...<sp:5:0:0>on
the journey of life?
Talk2024:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>I think a <clr:0000>mighty elixir<clr:ffff> is a fair trade.<sp:5:0:0>
What do you say?
Talk2002:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting>Hiii! Back again, huh? <clr:0000>Beedle <clr:ffff>will always
give you a warm welcome!
Talk2025:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughS>Something like that deserves a thank-you!
How about a <clr:0000>hasty elixir<clr:ffff>?

<sp:3:0:2:0100>It's one of my special concoctions. The
secret? <clr:0000>Hot-footed frog<clr:ffff> essence!
Talk2003:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>It's me! <clr:0000>Beedle<clr:ffff>! If you forget, my
<clr:0000>beetle-shaped<clr:ffff> pack is right here to
remind you.
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>In this topsy-turvy world, there's only
one direction to go—forward! So when
I travel, it's forward all the way!
<sp:3:0:2:0000>I can sell you bugs of the highest quality.
And if you need anything else on your
life journey, I can sell you that too!
Short on <clr:0000>rupees<clr:ffff>? Don't worry! I'll buy
anything you don't want weighing
you down.
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS>And what better way to lighten up than to
sell your rocks? <clr:0000>Gemstones<clr:ffff> in particular
fetch a high price!
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:CustomUrge>Well, well. What'll it be?
Talk2026:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Ooo! <sp:5:1:0>Do Beedle's eyes deceive him?
Or is that a <clr:0000>bladed rhino beetle<clr:ffff>?

<sp:3:0:2:0801>I have such a weakness for <clr:0000>bladed rhino
beetles<clr:ffff>! Will you give it to me? Pleeease?
Talk2004:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:CustomUrge>Well then, can I tempt you to buy? Or are
you selling today?
Talk2027:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>Oh?<sp:5:1:0> What's this?<sp:5:1:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseL>Th-that's an <clr:0000>energetic rhino beetle<clr:ffff>! You
don't see one of those beauties often!

<sp:3:0:2:0801>You'll...you'll give it to me, right?!
Com_Talk_20: <sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughS>I have lots of good stuff. Take your time!
Talk2028:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Wow! <sp:5:1:0>Is that a <clr:0000>rugged rhino beetle<clr:ffff> I spy
in your inventory?

<sp:3:0:2:0801>I LOVE <clr:0000>rugged rhino beetles<clr:ffff>! Will you give
it to me?
Talk2008:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>If you find another one, I'll take it
tomorrow! Today I'm busy taking care
of this sweetheart...<sp:5:1:0>
Talk2009:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Whoa! Thanks for your business!<sp:5:1:0> And a
special bonus thank-you for that <clr:0000>beetle<clr:ffff>!<sp:5:1:0>
Com_Talk_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Oh...<sp:5:0:0> Come back when you ARE ready
to sell.
Com_Talk_06: <sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:CustomUrge>Take a look at the rest of my stock.
Com_Talk_07:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>All sold out. <sp:5:1:0>You'll have to wait for my
next restock.
Com_Talk_Hello:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting>Hey there! We meet again! Are you still
moving forward on this little journey we
call life?
Com_Talk_08:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Angry>Not enough <clr:0000>rupees<clr:ffff>!<sp:5:1:0> Come back when
your wallet isn't so light.
Com_Talk_09:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Think>Huh? Your <clr:0000>pouch<clr:ffff> is full.<sp:5:1:0> Do you really
need all that stuff?
Talk0030:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Are you getting rid of this <clr:0000>cold darner<clr:ffff>
because it's developed a taste for
your fingers?
These ferocious little darlings have quite
the bite!

<sp:3:0:2:0100>Here's a special Beedle tip. Gently hold
the wings together with your fingertips,
and zing! Happy darner, happy fingers!
Talk0031:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>To be parting with this lovely <clr:0000>summerwing
butterfly<clr:ffff>...<sp:5:1:0> Were you perhaps hoping to
catch a female summerwing instead?
<sp:3:0:2:0100>The males are vibrant and striking, but
females have muted colors that mimic
trees and leaves.
They're so hard to see that even Beedle
has trouble catching them!
Talk0032:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:SurpriseS>Was the <clr:0000>smotherwing butterfly<clr:ffff>'s diet
too much for you?<sp:5:1:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0100>This little gourmand can taste with its
legs, and it doesn't settle for second best.

<sp:3:0:2:0301>It's going to cost Beedle a fortune to
prepare a four-course meal every night.
Talk0033:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>You aren't getting rid of your <clr:0000>thunderwing
butterfly<clr:ffff> because you're worried about
the smell, are you?<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0100>Don't worry—only the larvae are stinky!<sp:5:0:0>
And that's only if they feel threatened.<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:5000>When will they learn Beedle just wants to love them?<sp:0:2:2:6400>
